title: The Physics of Core-Collapse Supernovae
author: Harrison, S. M.
Chen, L.
Williams, R. J.
docs.abstract: We present a comprehensive review of core-collapse supernova physics, including the explosion mechanism, nucleosynthesis, and remnant formation. New 3D simulations reveal the critical role of neutrino-driven convection.

title: Type Ia Supernova Cosmology: A Review
author: Baker, E. T.
Rodriguez, M.
Kim, J. H.
Singh, A.
docs.abstract: Type Ia supernovae remain the premier standard candles for cosmology. This review covers standardization techniques, systematic uncertainties, and implications for dark energy measurements.
docs.pub: Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society

title: Supernova Remnant Evolution in Different Environments
author: Mueller, K.
Thompson, D. W.
docs.abstract: We study supernova remnant evolution across diverse interstellar medium conditions. Hydrodynamic simulations reveal significant morphological differences based on ambient density and magnetic field strength.
